PSA: Renewing Illinois Registration without Renewal Notice

A note to Illinois drivers

    Into the Future

  • I Voted!

    I did it again

  • A Call for Less Process

    Ranting - can't we all just get along

    • Check me out!

    Riot for fast ruby testing, Jubilator for GitHub browsing, Seota for semi-automatic SEO help, Animal Cracker for Rack asset hosting assistance, Chicago for Sinatra helpers

Oct 18, 2008

You live in Illinois?

You need to get a new sticker for that license plate of yours (even though you also pay for the metal it’s attached to)?

You lost your renewal notice that they sent you in the email or you just plain never received it (yeah right)?

No problem. Just head over to your local DMV with a drivers license (preferably yours) and something that shows your license plate number - such as last year’s registration slip.

Oh yeah, and bring a 100 friggin’ dollars to renew your privilege to drive unencumbered by the state, in the state.
